title: A nearly 10% S&P 500 correction last September has stock-market investors dreading autumn 2021
text:
‘They've been silent': Many companies are on the sidelines about the new Texas abortion law — will they stay there?

Lyft and Uber said Friday they would cover legal costs for any drivers sued under S.B. 8, the Texas law that allows people to sue anyone who 'aids or abets' an abortion. See full story.

Forget short-term stock-market fads and just buy these 5 rocketing tech stocks

Jeff Reeves goes well beyond the FAAMNG stocks. See full story.

My in-laws want to sell us their home for $100,000, so that we can fix and flip it. Should we refinance our mortgage to pay for this?

'We can refinance our home for 15 years — we currently have eight years left on our mortgage — to purchase and fix their home.' See full story.

Apple is playing a shell game with its App Store changes, but that can't last forever

Apple nibbles around the corners of its massive App Store business to appease developers and regulators, all while trying to maintain its hefty fees in the biggest markets such as video games. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

Defendant Jasmine Clifford's co-conspirator would fraudulently enter customers into the New York vaccine database for an extra $250, prosecutors said. See full story.
